article.headline: Massachusetts 76, Fordham 63
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- Rashaun Freeman scored 26 points and Anthony Anderson added 23 to power Massachusetts past Fordham, 76-63 on Wednesday night. Fordham (6-10, 2-3 Atlantic 10) took the lead several times in the second half, the last time at 48-47 on a basket by Muchon Ya'akosi just past the 10-minute mark. But Anderson, Maurice Maxwell and Stephane Lasme then made successive baskets to put UMass (9-6, 3-2) ahead for good. Freeman went 9-for-13 from the field and 8-for-9 from the foul line, adding 7 rebounds. He scored 18 of his points in the first half. Marcus Stout had 20 points and Jermaine Anderson added 17 for Fordham. Fordham led early at 16-9 before UMass made a 12-0 run to take the lead. The Minutemen led 33-29 at halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
